item.title: Aam
item.description: ‘Alaa sabeeli ijtimaa: It is inclusive to many meanings This is a diagram that summarises Aam: Aam is divided into 2 types: Khussa ‘anhu shay’ tawbah:5-6 - Specified to the warzone only Lam yukhassa ‘anhu shay’ tawbah:100 - All of the ansar are included, they are not limited The meaning of a khas term can be repealed by an aam.

item.title: Haqiqah
item.description: Definition A word being used in the meaning it was derived for Here is a diagram of Haqiqah: Example: A person swears by Allah that they will not eat from this tree.

item.title: Introduction to Usul Fiqh
item.description: What is Usul Fiqh? It is a set of principles that allows you to derive rulings from their evidences The ahnaf were the first to establish usul In the past, scholars did not require them to be documented The principles of Fiqh are 4: From Dala’il Sam’iyyah: Kitab-ullah: 500+ ayaat relating to ahkam Sunnatu-rasooli: An Action of the Prophet (s.

item.title: Khas
item.description: Translation: Specific There are 3 types of Khas Khasul fard A word used for a specific reason, or one person Qat’i and yaqeeni Nobody can be added to its understanding Khasul naw' Specific to one type i.

item.title: Mu'awwal
item.description: Definition: One that has been given precedence over all other meanings. Example of thalathata quroo. The hayd from quroo was made Muâ€™awwal over the other meanings I.

item.title: Mushtarak
item.description: By definition It can potentially cater for many things in its meaning. This is the difference between Aam and this. It has the capacity for many but does not.

item.title: Umoomu Majaz
item.description: Definition Diverting from the literal meaning, towards the culturally understood and accepted meaning. Umoom: comes from aam. In other words; what the general society deem acceptable.

item.title: Understanding Qur'anic words
item.description: There are 20 ways of understanding Qur’anic words: Khas Aam Mushtarak Mu’awwal Haqiqah Majaz Sareeh Kinayah Dhahir Nass Mufassar Muhkam Khafiy Mushkil Mujmal Mutashabih ‘ibaratun-nass isharatun-nass dalaalatun-nass iqtidaa-un-nass
